title: How true is it that history taught in Japanese schools doesn't include their occupation in the Philippines? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is true that the Japanese public schools teach the history of the occupation in the Philippines by the army. However, I really want you to know that Japanese students study little about the fact because the students only study for the entrance examinations for universities. The examinations seldom question about the occupations.

If the Japanese occupation of the Philippines is mentioned it is in terms of Japan’s “liberation” of the Philippines from the Americans, and with no mention of the war crimes and crimes against humanity that Japanese forces committed against the Philippine people.
